channel.title: Tests on PHI 14f
channel.description: Recent content in Tests on PHI 14f

item.title: Test 2 Questions
item.description: The questions for the second test will be posted here at the exam time (10:30, Tuesday, December 2). It will be designed to take ou not more than 90 minutes. It will be due, via upload, by 5 PM, on Saturday, December 5. The test will consist of written questions. You should study by reviewing your notes, and perhaps what you underlined or annotated in the texts. You will be able to use all your notes.

item.title: Test 1 Questions
item.description: Here are the questions for the first test. The test will be from a subset of these questions. For each question, write at least five sentences (minimum) and perhaps a bit more than five. Write concisely and informatively. If there is more than one part to the question, make sure to answer all the parts. What is Blackburn’s “middle-ground” defense of philosophy. What is Blackburn’s “low-ground” defense of philosophy. In Apology, what does Socrates say is the greatest good for a human being (“a man”), and what does he say that supports that?
